questions.question: The Tropic of Cancer passes through how many states of India?
questions.explanation: The Tropic of Cancer passes through 8 states in India.

questions.question: Which is the largest desert in the world?
questions.explanation: The Antarctic Desert is the largest desert in the world.

questions.question: Mount Kilimanjaro is located in which country?
questions.explanation: Mount Kilimanjaro is located in Tanzania.

questions.question: The Suez Canal connects which two seas?
questions.explanation: The Suez Canal connects the Red Sea and the Mediterranean Sea.

questions.question: The Great Barrier Reef is located off the coast of which country?
questions.explanation: The Great Barrier Reef is located off the coast of Australia.

questions.question: Which river is the longest in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile is the longest river in the world.

questions.question: The highest plateau in the world is:
questions.explanation: The Tibetan Plateau is the highest plateau in the world.

questions.question: Which strait separates Asia from North America?
questions.explanation: The Bering Strait separates Asia and North America.

questions.question: The Dead Sea lies between Israel/Palestine and Jordan. Its extremely high salinity is primarily due to:
questions.explanation: The Dead Sea's high salinity is due to high evaporation and no outlet for its water.

questions.question: The Pacific “Ring of Fire” is so seismically active mainly because:
options: It has many rivers and deltas
It is a zone of converging tectonic plates
questions.explanation: The 'Ring of Fire' is a zone of converging tectonic plates, causing high seismic activity.

questions.question: Which ocean current is known as the “warm current” in the Atlantic Ocean?
questions.explanation: The Gulf Stream is a warm and swift Atlantic Ocean current.

questions.question: The world’s largest delta is formed by which river system?
questions.explanation: The Ganga-Brahmaputra Delta is the world's largest.

questions.question: Which African country has the most pyramids?
questions.explanation: Sudan has more pyramids than Egypt.

questions.question: Lake Baikal, the world’s deepest freshwater lake, is located in which country?
questions.explanation: Lake Baikal is located in Russia.

questions.question: The Great Rift Valley stretches across which continent?
questions.explanation: The Great Rift Valley stretches across Africa.

questions.question: The Wallace Line is a boundary separating the ecozones of:
questions.explanation: The Wallace Line separates the ecozones of Asia and Australia.

questions.question: The Danube River flows into which sea?
questions.explanation: The Danube River flows into the Black Sea.

questions.question: The Atacama Desert, one of the driest places on Earth, is located in:
questions.explanation: The Atacama Desert is located in Chile.

questions.question: Which mountain range forms the natural boundary between Europe and Asia?
questions.explanation: The Ural Mountains form the natural boundary between Europe and Asia.

questions.question: The Challenger Deep is located in which ocean?
questions.explanation: The Challenger Deep is the deepest known point in the Pacific Ocean.

questions.question: Which city is called the “City of Canals” outside Europe?
questions.explanation: Bangkok is known as the 'Venice of the East' or 'City of Canals'.

questions.question: The Great Dividing Range is located in which country?
questions.explanation: The Great Dividing Range is a mountain range in Australia.

questions.question: Which desert is sometimes called the “Roof of the World”?
questions.explanation: The Pamir Mountains are known as the 'Roof of the World'.

questions.question: Which river is sacred to both Hindus and Buddhists?
questions.explanation: The Ganga (Ganges) river is sacred to both Hindus and Buddhists.

questions.question: Which European capital city is located on two continents?
questions.explanation: Istanbul is located on both the European and Asian continents.

questions.question: The Mariana Trench is closest to which island group?
questions.explanation: The Mariana Trench is closest to the Philippines.

questions.question: The world’s largest island (not a continent) is:
questions.explanation: Greenland is the world's largest island.

questions.question: Which line of latitude is also called the “Circle of Illumination”?
questions.explanation: The Equator is also known as the Circle of Illumination, as it is the line that divides the Earth into day and night.

questions.question: The Strait of Gibraltar separates:
questions.explanation: The Strait of Gibraltar separates Europe and Africa.

questions.question: Which African lake is the source of the White Nile?
questions.explanation: Lake Victoria is the source of the White Nile.
